result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard T Quagon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 05/16/2017 AMENDED: PROBATION IS EXTENDED FOR A PERIOD OF 1 YEAR BUT CAN BE TERMINATED EARLY IF ALL FINANCIALS ARE PAID.

miscConds.notes: Per C-31. Must be repaid at a minimum rate of $50.00 per month.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
05/16/17 AMENDED: MUST SEEK WORK AT 5 PLACES PER WEEK IF UNEMPLOYED OR UNDEREMPLOYED AND REPORT EFFORTS TO THE PROBATION AGENT.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 6 days credit if revoked from probation.

records.addlTxt: to Modify Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Leonard T Quagon in court.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation agent Heather Lasaard present in court by telephone.
Payments discussed. Good faith effort is not being made.  Defendant has a new job.  Wage assignment will be set up with employer at  $50 per month  /  $25 per pay check.  Agent will prepare the wage assignment for employer.  Probation agent relates that
Probation will be extended for another year but  court relates probation can be terminated earlier if all financials are paid.  $50 payment will be made to agent tomorrow.
Judgment of conviction to be amended to add:  Must seek work at 5 businesses per week and must report efforts to the agent.   Court prepares an order, copy given to defendant and DA.
Review hearing on May 16, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Unpaid

Defendant Leonard T Quagon in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Leonard T Quagon in custody.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State moves to amend to 943.01(1) and court grants. Defendant pleads guilty.  Court questions, accepts, and finds guilty.  Court orders 1 year probation, 6 days credit, $500.00 in restitution to be paid at $50.00 per month, 

Defendant addresses the court.

Court orders SW, 1 year probation, 6 days jail credit if revoked, $500.00 in restitution to be paid at a minimum of $50.00 per month, court costs, comply with any recommendations by probation.
  
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Specimen to be provided immediately.
